poem:
Title: "Weight of the Letter"

In the hand of politics, the Post Office trembles,
A paper ship in a storm of justice, 
Scandals its ink-dark sea. 
Veering to the blind helm of its operators,
A fate unknown yet tethered by familiar 
stamps of bygone errors.
This week, at the table of power,
Will they mend the sails, 
Or instead install anchors?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Government to discuss handing ownership of Post Office to its operators The government is to meet representatives of post office operators this week to discuss the possibility of handing them ownership of the Post Office. The move follows a chastening few months for the government and the network after historical scandals – frequently described as “the most widespread miscarriage of justice in UK history” – caught the public imagination with the broadcast of ITV’s drama". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
